timeline.message: DEV-1122 Add CRAM conversion to pipeline

timeline.bodyText: I think the Substage interface would work well for this
timeline.author: pauldwolfe

replies.bodyText: Sorry wasn't ignoring this suggestion, just forgot. But now that I look more closely at it, I'd have to do some gymnastics to use the substages from the batch side because it doesn't really care about samples (it deals generically with input files) and I'm not sure whether it's worth the effort. For the pipeline invocation it makes more sense but not sure whether that's compelling by itself.
replies.author: nedleitch

replies.bodyText: I don't think it would be too hard to remove the references to samples, but also fine to leave this for now and make that a part of another separate refactoring task.
replies.author: pauldwolfe

timeline.bodyText: I see we add the CRAM here to the final output I guess we want to remove the BAM from the aligner report components as well?
timeline.author: pauldwolfe

replies.bodyText: Or maybe you were thinking we persist both to start?
replies.author: pauldwolfe

replies.bodyText: I was. But maybe that's overly cautious and not really beneficial.
replies.author: nedleitch

timeline.bodyText: I think we should have an option to enable/disable this feature
timeline.author: pauldwolfe

timeline.message:
DEV-1122 Put CRAM output behind feature toggle

Also fix a bug in the image import script that I noticed while pushing
the image for manual testing.

In addition add some options to the InputFileDescriptor class to
significantly improve download speed for batch files. Also scale down
the required disk space for the batch converter.
DEV-1122 Do not store BAMs when outputting CRAMs

DEV-1122 Don't copy new BAMs after CRAM finishes

The CRAM conversion generates a BAM from the new CRAM and then
compares that to the original. These are not generally useful
to copy up to the cloud, but we do want to keep them around if
there is anything out of ordinary. Move them to another folder
so they aren't automatically copied up on job completion.

timeline.author: pauldwolfe
